Riffs from the Underworld

Hades The Metalhead

Embark on an epic auditory journey with five unique instrumental pieces. Each track paints a distinct soundscape, taking you from the imposing, powerful gates of the underworld to the serene, ethereal Elysium fields. Traverse the murky River Styx and tremble at the depths of Tartarus, before ascending towards the hopeful Asphodel skies. All brought to life through a blend of heavy metal intensity and the grandeur of ancient Greek instruments and symphony.

Underworld Overture

An imposing, obsidian-black palace under a blood-red sky, the gateway to the underworld. Flames dance, casting long, eerie shadows. In the distance, skeletal trees and spectral figures under the twilight.

Echoes of Elysium

Verdant fields and golden skies, but with an ethereal, almost dreamlike quality. Souls of the virtuous roam free, appearing as glowing specters, peaceful amidst the celestial landscape.

River Styx Serenade

A wide, murky river under a starless sky. A lone figure rows a boat, ferrying spectral passengers. The water is mirror-like, reflecting the ghostly, phosphorescent figures.

Tartarus Tremors

A dark, ominous pit with flashes of lightning revealing monstrous silhouettes. Chains and the ruins of mighty fortifications hint at the torment and punishment within.

Asphodel Ascendance

Fields of asphodel flowers under a twilight sky, a pathway of stars leading upwards. Transparent souls ascend, their forms flickering like fireflies.
